title: 110_hr2599
content: The Act titled "Inactive Reservists Foreclosure Prevention Act of 2007" includes a Mortgage Assistance Program. The Mortgage Assistance Program under the "Inactive Reservists Foreclosure Prevention Act of 2007" provides grants and loans for direct mortgage payments to eligible households meeting specific requirements. The Mortgage Assistance Program offers grants and loans for mortgage payments to eligible households with arrears under a residential property mortgage. The property must be designed for residential use and serve as the primary residence for the mortgagor and their household. The Mortgage Assistance Program provides grants and loans for mortgage payments to eligible households with arrears under a residential property mortgage. The Mortgage Assistance Program pays monthly mortgage assistance directly to the mortgagee for eligible mortgages during active duty in the Armed Forces for more than 30 days. The Mortgage Assistance Program reserves sufficient amounts to provide assistance for unpredictable extensions in active duty periods of eligible Armed Forces members. The Secretary determines the assistance amount based on established criteria, with limitations on the maximum monthly assistance payment for eligible mortgages. The Mortgage Assistance Program provides monthly payments for principal, interest, mortgage insurance, and escrow deposits to ensure payment of taxes and insurance. The Secretary establishes an aggregate assistance amount over the program's duration, considering the total program funding. The Secretary also prevents double payments to ensure payment accuracy. The Mortgage Assistance Program ensures accurate payments by requiring the return or immediate credit of any duplicate payments made by a mortgagor, with prompt notification to the mortgagor. The Mortgage Assistance Program ensures accurate payments by requiring the return or immediate credit of any duplicate payments made by a mortgagor, with prompt notification to the mortgagor. Repayment of assistance is mandated. The Mortgage Assistance Program provides grant assistance to eligible mortgages with household incomes below 200 percent of the poverty line, with no repayment required except in cases of foreclosure or default. The Secretary will terminate assistance under the Act for mortgages in default, converting previous assistance into a loan. Any assistance provided when household income exceeds 200 percent of the poverty line will be in the form of a no-interest loan with a 10-year term. Repayment of the loan provided under the Act will be secured by a lien on the residential property subject to the eligible mortgage. The lien will be held by the Secretary and subordinate to other mortgages and liens on the property. The terms of the loan will be outlined in a written agreement. The terms of the loan will be outlined in a written agreement between the Secretary and the mortgagor. SEC. 5. APPLICATION FOR ASSISTANCE. To be eligible for mortgage assistance under this Act, a mortgagor must submit an application providing required information, including a financial statement disclosing household income. The Secretary will notify the mortgagee and servicer upon application submission. The mortgagor must submit an application for mortgage assistance under this Act, including income information for the household. The Secretary will notify the mortgagee and servicer upon application submission. Based on a certification, the Secretary will review applications for mortgage assistance under this Act within 30 days. Intentional misrepresentation of financial information may result in denial of assistance and repayment of any received funds. The mortgagee can take legal action if necessary. The Secretary must notify the mortgagor, mortgagee, and servicer of approval or disapproval of the mortgage assistance application within 30 days. Failure to do so will result in the mortgage being considered approved for assistance. SEC. 6. COORDINATION WITH OTHER AGENCIES AND ENTITIES. The Secretary will ensure eligible households and Armed Forces members are informed about mortgage assistance. This may involve coordination with various agencies and entities. States, agencies, lenders, and other entities may assist in implementing the program. The Secretary may enter agreements with entities to carry out functions for mortgage assistance program under the Act in an effective manner. SEC. 7. SAVINGS CLAUSE. This Act does not affect the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act. SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. For the purposes of this Act, definitions include "active duty" as defined in section 101(d) of title 10, United States Code, "eligible member of the Armed Forces" serving on active duty for more than 30 days, "eligible mortgage" meeting requirements for assistance, and "eligible household" meeting specified criteria. A household eligible for mortgage assistance under this Act includes a member of the Armed Forces and their dependents. Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies refer to specific government entities. The term "income" for an eligible mortgagor refers to the total income of each household member. The terms "mortgage", "mortgagee", and "mortgagor" are defined in the National Housing Act. The "poverty line" is defined in the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1981. The "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The term "servicer" is defined in the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act of 1974. Authorization of appropriations for mortgage assistance under this Act is provided for fiscal years 2008-2012. The Secretary must issue regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment to implement the mortgage assistance program.
